subject: Art & Design
title: The Roaring Twenties: Flappers and Freedom
description: A fast breakdown of The Roaring Twenties: Flappers and Freedom for builders.

hook.text: Hemlines rose above the knee for the first time in Western history.

discovery.text: Coco Chanel championed comfort: jersey fabric, trousers, and the little black dress.

twist.text: The freedom was partial. The boyish, flat-chested ideal was just a different body standard, not the absence of one.

climax.text: Art Deco geometry influenced fashion: zigzag patterns, metallic fabrics, and angular cuts mirrored architecture and art.

punchline.text: The flapper didn't just shorten the skirt.

quiz.question: What social change drove 1920s flapper fashion?
options: Women entering the workforce and seeking liberation after WWI
A fabric shortage that required shorter garments
